result.execSummary:
The defendant David D.B. Menehan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:34 PM 
Defendant David D.B. Menehan in court.  Attorney Robert S. Duxstad in court for David D.B. Menehan.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Duxstad Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" .
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Duxstad re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

Defendant has paid restitution in full today.

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Duxstad joins in the motion.

Court Orders: $100.00 Fine + Costs - Both Counts
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:12 PM 
Defendant David D.B. Menehan in court.  Attorney Robert S. Duxstad in court for David D.B. Menehan.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Duxstad informs the court this matter is resolved.
Defendant wishes not to exercise his speedy trial demand.
Trial can be removed from the jury calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
